reviewText: I bought it for my Nursing Home Residents diagnosed with Dementia. It was to serve as music Memory... It was black and white. I really  can't say that it kept them engaged which is what I was hoping for.. Sorry that's all I can say.....

If you've seen Rock Around the Clock you will no doubt get a feeling of deja vu. Too bad this movie doesn't make use of more of its talents... very few "A" list songs performed as part of this movie. And the number of people required to play a rock'n roll song? At one point there were almost more people on the stage than in the audience.

I was left with many questions: What IS Dizzy's job, anyway? Why would a woman be so intent on making a guy marry her when he HATES her?  And what is with sandpapering shoes?
The dvd was very high quality, despite being an histori performance. Delivery was very prompt. Well worth viewing for the younger generation.
